http://edamontology.org/data_3736.description: Data concerning ecology; for example measurements and reports from the study of interactions among organisms and their environment.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_3739.label: Gamma diversity data
http://edamontology.org/data_3739.description: The total species diversity in a landscape.

http://edamontology.org/data_3738.label: Beta diversity data
http://edamontology.org/data_3738.description: The ratio between regional and local species diversity.

http://edamontology.org/data_3737.label: Alpha diversity data
http://edamontology.org/data_3737.description: The mean species diversity in sites or habitats at a local scale.

http://edamontology.org/data_3669.label: Training material
http://edamontology.org/data_3669.description: Some material that is used for educational (training) purposes.

http://edamontology.org/data_3670.label: Online course
http://edamontology.org/data_3670.description: A training course available for use on the Web.

http://edamontology.org/data_3498.label: Sequence variations
http://edamontology.org/data_3498.description: Data on gene sequence variations resulting large-scale genotyping and DNA sequencing projects.|Variations are stored along with a reference genome.

http://edamontology.org/data_3483.label: Spectrum
http://edamontology.org/data_3483.description: The spectrum of frequencies of electromagnetic radiation emitted from a molecule as a result of some spectroscopy experiment.

http://edamontology.org/data_3488.label: NMR spectrum
http://edamontology.org/data_3488.description: Spectral information for a molecule from a nuclear magnetic resonance experiment.

http://edamontology.org/data_3108.label: Experimental measurement
http://edamontology.org/data_3108.description: Raw data such as measurements or other results from laboratory experiments, as generated from laboratory hardware.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types. It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.

http://edamontology.org/data_3724.label: Cultivation parameter
http://edamontology.org/data_3724.description: Experimental determined parameter for the cultivation of an organism.

http://edamontology.org/data_3723.label: Morphology parameter
http://edamontology.org/data_3723.description: Experimentally determined parameter of the morphology of an organism, e.g. size & shape.

http://edamontology.org/data_3722.label: Physiology parameter
http://edamontology.org/data_3722.description: Experimentally determined parameter of the physiology of an organism, e.g. substrate spectrum.

http://edamontology.org/data_3110.label: Raw microarray data
http://edamontology.org/data_3110.description: Raw data (typically MIAME-compliant) for hybridisations from a microarray experiment.|Such data as found in Affymetrix CEL or GPR files.

http://edamontology.org/data_2537.label: Protein structure raw data
http://edamontology.org/data_2537.description: Raw data from experimental methods for determining protein structure.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.

http://edamontology.org/data_0939.label: Protein circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data
http://edamontology.org/data_0939.description: Protein secondary structure from protein coordinate or circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data.

http://edamontology.org/data_0938.label: Protein NMR data
http://edamontology.org/data_0938.description: Protein nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) raw data.

http://edamontology.org/data_2536.label: Mass spectrometry data
http://edamontology.org/data_2536.description: Data concerning a mass spectrometry measurement.

http://edamontology.org/data_0944.label: Peptide mass fingerprint
http://edamontology.org/data_0944.description: A set of peptide masses (peptide mass fingerprint) from mass spectrometry.|A molecular weight standard fingerprint is standard protonated molecular masses e.g. from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides.

http://edamontology.org/data_0940.label: Electron microscopy volume map
http://edamontology.org/data_0940.description: Volume map data from electron microscopy.

http://edamontology.org/data_0926.label: Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores
http://edamontology.org/data_0926.description: Radiation hybrid scores (RH) scores for one or more markers.|Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores are used in Radiation Hybrid mapping.

http://edamontology.org/data_0924.label: Sequence trace
http://edamontology.org/data_0924.description: Fluorescence trace data generated by an automated DNA sequencer, which can be interprted as a molecular sequence (reads), given associated sequencing metadata such as base-call quality scores.|This is the raw data produced by a DNA sequencing machine.

http://edamontology.org/data_0905.label: Protein interaction raw data
http://edamontology.org/data_0905.description: Protein-protein interaction data from for example yeast two-hybrid analysis, protein microarrays, immunoaffinity chromatography followed by mass spectrometry, phage display etc.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.

http://edamontology.org/data_3028.label: Taxonomy
http://edamontology.org/data_3028.description: Data concerning the classification, identification and naming of organisms.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_2978.label: Reaction data
http://edamontology.org/data_2978.description: Data concerning a biochemical reaction, typically data and more general annotation on the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_2024.label: Enzyme kinetics data
http://edamontology.org/data_2024.description: Data concerning chemical reaction(s) catalysed by enzyme(s).|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_2026.label: Hanes Woolf plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2026.description: A plot based on the Michaelis Menten equation of enzyme kinetics plotting the ratio of the initial substrate concentration (S) against the reaction velocity (v).

http://edamontology.org/data_2025.label: Michaelis Menten plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2025.description: A plot giving an approximation of the kinetics of an enzyme-catalysed reaction, assuming simple kinetics (i.e. no intermediate or product inhibition, allostericity or cooperativity). It plots initial reaction rate to the substrate concentration (S) from which the maximum rate (vmax) is apparent.

http://edamontology.org/data_0910.label: Km
http://edamontology.org/data_0910.description: Km is the concentration (usually in Molar units) of substrate that leads to half-maximal velocity of an enzyme-catalysed reaction.

http://edamontology.org/data_0909.label: Vmax
http://edamontology.org/data_0909.description: The maximum initial velocity or rate of a reaction. It is the limiting velocity as substrate concentrations get very large.

http://edamontology.org/data_2968.label: Image
http://edamontology.org/data_2968.description: Biological or biomedical data has been rendered into an image, typically for display on screen.

http://edamontology.org/data_3449.label: Cell migration track image
http://edamontology.org/data_3449.description: An image from a cell migration track assay.

http://edamontology.org/data_3424.label: Raw image
http://edamontology.org/data_3424.description: Raw biological or biomedical image generated by some experimental technique.

http://edamontology.org/data_3808.label: EM Micrograph
http://edamontology.org/data_3808.description: Raw acquistion from electron microscopy or average of an aligned DDD movie.

http://edamontology.org/data_3807.label: EM Movie
http://edamontology.org/data_3807.description: Raw DDD movie acquisition from electron microscopy.

http://edamontology.org/data_3442.label: MRI image
http://edamontology.org/data_3442.description: An imaging technique that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.

http://edamontology.org/data_2586.label: Northern blot image
http://edamontology.org/data_2586.description: An image arising from a Northern Blot experiment.

http://edamontology.org/data_1714.label: Microarray spots image
http://edamontology.org/data_1714.description: An image of spots from a microarray experiment.

http://edamontology.org/data_2163.label: Helical net
http://edamontology.org/data_2163.description: An image of peptide sequence sequence in a simple 3,4,3,4 repeating pattern that emulates at a simple level the arrangement of residues around an alpha helix.|Useful for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.

http://edamontology.org/data_2162.label: Helical wheel
http://edamontology.org/data_2162.description: An image of peptide sequence sequence looking down the axis of the helix for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.

http://edamontology.org/data_2969.label: Sequence image
http://edamontology.org/data_2969.description: Image of a molecular sequence, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.

http://edamontology.org/data_2168.label: Sequence trace image
http://edamontology.org/data_2168.description: Image of a sequence trace (nucleotide sequence versus probabilities of each of the 4 bases).

http://edamontology.org/data_1289.label: Restriction map
http://edamontology.org/data_1289.description: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1713.label: Fate map
http://edamontology.org/data_1713.description: A fate map is a plan of early stage of an embryo such as a blastula, showing areas that are significance to development.

http://edamontology.org/data_1711.label: Sequence alignment image
http://edamontology.org/data_1711.description: Image of two or more aligned molecular sequences possibly annotated with alignment features.

http://edamontology.org/data_1710.label: Structure image
http://edamontology.org/data_1710.description: Image of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1712.label: Chemical structure image
http://edamontology.org/data_1712.description: An image of the structure of a small chemical compound.|The molecular identifier and formula are typically included.

http://edamontology.org/data_3490.label: Chemical structure sketch
http://edamontology.org/data_3490.description: A sketch of a small molecule made with some specialised drawing package.|Chemical structure sketches are used for presentational purposes but also as inputs to various analysis software.

http://edamontology.org/data_1708.label: RNA secondary structure image
http://edamontology.org/data_1708.description: Image of RNA secondary structure, knots, pseudoknots etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1707.label: Phylogenetic tree image
http://edamontology.org/data_1707.description: An image (for viewing or printing) of a phylogenetic tree including (typically) a plot of rooted or unrooted phylogenies, cladograms, circular trees or phenograms and associated information.|See also 'Phylogenetic tree'

http://edamontology.org/data_1636.label: Heat map
http://edamontology.org/data_1636.description: A graphical 2D tabular representation of gene expression data, typically derived from a DNA microarray experiment.|A heat map is a table where rows and columns correspond to different genes and contexts (for example, cells or samples) and the cell color represents the level of expression of a gene that context.

http://edamontology.org/data_1022.label: Sequence feature label
http://edamontology.org/data_1022.description: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user. Typically an EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature label.|A feature label identifies a feature of a sequence database entry. When used with the database name and the entry's primary accession number, it is a unique identifier of that feature.

http://edamontology.org/data_1021.label: Sequence feature qualifier
http://edamontology.org/data_1021.description: Typically one of the EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature qualifiers.|Feature qualifiers hold information about a feature beyond that provided by the feature key and location.

http://edamontology.org/data_1020.label: Sequence feature key
http://edamontology.org/data_1020.description: The type of a sequence feature, typically a term or accession from the Sequence Ontology, for example an EMBL or Swiss-Prot sequence feature key.|A feature key indicates the biological nature of the feature or information about changes to or versions of the sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_0856.label: Sequence feature source
http://edamontology.org/data_0856.description: How the annotation of a sequence feature (for example in EMBL or Swiss-Prot) was derived.|This might be the name and version of a software tool, the name of a database, or 'curated' to indicate a manual annotation (made by a human).

http://edamontology.org/data_2884.label: Plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2884.description: Biological data that has been plotted as a graph of some type.

http://edamontology.org/data_3743.label: Ordination plot
http://edamontology.org/data_3743.description: A plot in which community data (e.g. species abundance data) is summarised.  Similar species and samples are plotted close together, and dissimilar species and samples are plotted placed far apart.

http://edamontology.org/data_2958.label: Nucleic acid melting curve
http://edamontology.org/data_2958.description: A melting curve of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).|Shows the proportion of nucleic acid which are double-stranded versus temperature.

http://edamontology.org/data_2957.label: Hopp and Woods plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2957.description: A Hopp and Woods plot of predicted antigenicity of a peptide or protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_2167.label: Nucleic acid density plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2167.description: Density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_2166.label: Sequence composition plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2166.description: A plot of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_2165.label: Protein ionisation curve
http://edamontology.org/data_2165.description: A plot of pK versus pH for a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_2161.label: Sequence similarity plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2161.description: A plot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.|Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_2160.label: Fickett testcode plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2160.description: A plot of Fickett testcode statistic (identifying protein coding regions) in a nucleotide sequences.

http://edamontology.org/data_1595.label: Base pairing probability matrix dotplot
http://edamontology.org/data_1595.description: Dotplot of RNA base pairing probability matrix.|Such as generated by the Vienna package.

http://edamontology.org/data_1527.label: Protein titration curve
http://edamontology.org/data_1527.description: The titration curve of a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_2603.label: Gene expression data
http://edamontology.org/data_2603.description: Image, hybridisation or some other data arising from a study of gene expression, typically profiling or quantification.

http://edamontology.org/data_3768.label: Clustered gene expression profiles
http://edamontology.org/data_3768.description: Groupings of gene expression profiles according to a clustering algorithm.

http://edamontology.org/data_1636.label: Heat map
http://edamontology.org/data_1636.description: A graphical 2D tabular representation of gene expression data, typically derived from a DNA microarray experiment.|A heat map is a table where rows and columns correspond to different genes and contexts (for example, cells or samples) and the cell color represents the level of expression of a gene that context.

http://edamontology.org/data_3117.label: Microarray hybridisation data
http://edamontology.org/data_3117.description: Data concerning the hybridisations measured during a microarray experiment.

http://edamontology.org/data_3111.label: Processed microarray data
http://edamontology.org/data_3111.description: Data generated from processing and analysis of probe set data from a microarray experiment.|Such data as found in Affymetrix .CHP files or data from other software such as RMA or dChip.

http://edamontology.org/data_3110.label: Raw microarray data
http://edamontology.org/data_3110.description: Raw data (typically MIAME-compliant) for hybridisations from a microarray experiment.|Such data as found in Affymetrix CEL or GPR files.

http://edamontology.org/data_3115.label: Microarray metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_3115.description: Annotation on the array itself used in a microarray experiment.|This might include gene identifiers, genomic coordinates, probe oligonucleotide sequences etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_2717.label: Oligonucleotide probe annotation
http://edamontology.org/data_2717.description: General annotation on an oligonucleotide probe, or a set of probes.

http://edamontology.org/data_3112.label: Gene expression matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_3112.description: The final processed (normalised) data for a set of hybridisations in a microarray experiment.|This combines data from all hybridisations.

http://edamontology.org/data_1714.label: Microarray spots image
http://edamontology.org/data_1714.description: An image of spots from a microarray experiment.

http://edamontology.org/data_0928.label: Gene expression profile
http://edamontology.org/data_0928.description: Data quantifying the level of expression of (typically) multiple genes, derived for example from microarray experiments.

http://edamontology.org/data_2535.label: Sequence tag profile
http://edamontology.org/data_2535.description: Output from a serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE), massively parallel signature sequencing (MPSS) or sequencing by synthesis (SBS) experiment.  In all cases this is a list of short sequence tags and the number of times it is observed.|This includes tag to gene assignments (tag mapping) of SAGE, MPSS and SBS data. Typically this is the sequencing-based expression profile annotated with gene identifiers.|SAGE, MPSS and SBS experiments are usually performed to study gene expression.  The sequence tags are typically subsequently annotated (after a database search) with the mRNA (and therefore gene) the tag was extracted from.

http://edamontology.org/data_2600.label: Pathway or network
http://edamontology.org/data_2600.description: Primary data about a specific biological pathway or network (the nodes and connections within the pathway or network).

http://edamontology.org/data_2589.label: Hierarchy
http://edamontology.org/data_2589.description: Raw data on a biological hierarchy, describing the hierarchy proper, hierarchy components and possibly associated annotation.

http://edamontology.org/data_2534.label: Sequence attribute
http://edamontology.org/data_2534.description: An attribute of a molecular sequence, possibly in reference to some other sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_2190.label: Sequence checksum
http://edamontology.org/data_2190.description: A fixed-size datum calculated (by using a hash function) for a molecular sequence, typically for purposes of error detection or indexing.

http://edamontology.org/data_1771.label: Sequence version
http://edamontology.org/data_1771.description: Information on an molecular sequence version.

http://edamontology.org/data_1249.label: Sequence length
http://edamontology.org/data_1249.description: The size (length) of a sequence, subsequence or region in a sequence, or range(s) of lengths.

http://edamontology.org/data_1017.label: Sequence range
http://edamontology.org/data_1017.description: Specification of range(s) of sequence positions.

http://edamontology.org/data_2012.label: Sequence coordinates
http://edamontology.org/data_2012.description: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.|This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.

http://edamontology.org/data_3236.label: Cytoband position
http://edamontology.org/data_3236.description: The position of a cytogenetic band in a genome.|Information might include start and end position in a chromosome sequence, chromosome identifier, name of band and so on.

http://edamontology.org/data_1016.label: Sequence position
http://edamontology.org/data_1016.description: A position of one or more points (base or residue) in a sequence, or part of such a specification.

http://edamontology.org/data_2216.label: Codon number
http://edamontology.org/data_2216.description: The number of a codon, for instance, at which a mutation is located.

http://edamontology.org/data_2012.label: Sequence coordinates
http://edamontology.org/data_2012.description: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.|This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.

http://edamontology.org/data_3236.label: Cytoband position
http://edamontology.org/data_3236.description: The position of a cytogenetic band in a genome.|Information might include start and end position in a chromosome sequence, chromosome identifier, name of band and so on.

http://edamontology.org/data_1856.label: PDB insertion code
http://edamontology.org/data_1856.description: An insertion code (part of the residue number) for an amino acid residue from a PDB file.

http://edamontology.org/data_1742.label: PDB residue number
http://edamontology.org/data_1742.description: A residue identifier (a string) from a PDB file.

http://edamontology.org/data_2526.label: Text data
http://edamontology.org/data_2526.description: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of a scientific text (or texts) such as a full text article from a scientific journal.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. It includes concepts that are best described as scientific text or closely concerned with or derived from text.

http://edamontology.org/data_3779.label: Annotated text
http://edamontology.org/data_3779.description: A text (such as a scientific article), annotated with notes, data and metadata, such as recognised entities, concepts, and their relations.

http://edamontology.org/data_3671.label: Text
http://edamontology.org/data_3671.description: Any free or plain text, typically for human consumption and in English. Can instantiate also as a textual search query.

http://edamontology.org/data_3779.label: Annotated text
http://edamontology.org/data_3779.description: A text (such as a scientific article), annotated with notes, data and metadata, such as recognised entities, concepts, and their relations.

http://edamontology.org/data_0971.label: Article
http://edamontology.org/data_0971.description: A scientific text, typically a full text article from a scientific journal.

http://edamontology.org/data_3505.label: Bibliography
http://edamontology.org/data_3505.description: A list of publications such as scientic papers or books.

http://edamontology.org/data_2849.label: Abstract
http://edamontology.org/data_2849.description: An abstract of a scientific article.

http://edamontology.org/data_0972.label: Text mining report
http://edamontology.org/data_0972.description: An abstract of the results of text mining.|A text mining abstract will typically include an annotated a list of words or sentences extracted from one or more scientific articles.

http://edamontology.org/data_0971.label: Article
http://edamontology.org/data_0971.description: A scientific text, typically a full text article from a scientific journal.

http://edamontology.org/data_0970.label: Citation
http://edamontology.org/data_0970.description: Bibliographic data that uniquely identifies a scientific article, book or other published material.|A bibliographic reference might include information such as authors, title, journal name, date and (possibly) a link to the abstract or full-text of the article if available.

http://edamontology.org/data_2523.label: Phylogenetic data
http://edamontology.org/data_2523.description: Data concerning phylogeny, typically of molecular sequences, including reports of information concerning or derived from a phylogenetic tree, or from comparing two or more phylogenetic trees.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_2994.label: Phylogenetic character weights
http://edamontology.org/data_2994.description: Weights for sequence positions or characters in phylogenetic analysis where zero is defined as unweighted.

http://edamontology.org/data_1444.label: Phylogenetic character contrasts
http://edamontology.org/data_1444.description: Independent contrasts for characters used in a phylogenetic tree, or covariances, regressions and correlations between characters for those contrasts.

http://edamontology.org/data_1442.label: Phylogenetic tree distances
http://edamontology.org/data_1442.description: Distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees.

http://edamontology.org/data_1429.label: Phylogenetic invariants
http://edamontology.org/data_1429.description: Phylogenetic invariants data for testing alternative tree topologies.

http://edamontology.org/data_1428.label: Phylogenetic character cliques
http://edamontology.org/data_1428.description: One or more cliques of mutually compatible characters that are generated, for example from analysis of discrete character data, and are used to generate a phylogeny.

http://edamontology.org/data_0872.label: Phylogenetic tree
http://edamontology.org/data_0872.description: The raw data (not just an image) from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted, such as topology, lengths (in time or in expected amounts of variance) and a confidence interval for each length.|A phylogenetic tree is usually constructed from a set of sequences from which an alignment (or data matrix) is calculated. See also 'Phylogenetic tree image'.

http://edamontology.org/data_3272.label: Species tree
http://edamontology.org/data_3272.description: A phylogenetic tree that reflects phylogeny of the taxa from which the characters (used in calculating the tree) were sampled.

http://edamontology.org/data_3271.label: Gene tree
http://edamontology.org/data_3271.description: A phylogenetic tree that is an estimate of the character's phylogeny.

http://edamontology.org/data_0871.label: Phylogenetic character data
http://edamontology.org/data_0871.description: Basic character data from which a phylogenetic tree may be generated.|As defined, this concept would also include molecular sequences, microsatellites, polymorphisms (RAPDs, RFLPs, or AFLPs), restriction sites and fragments

http://edamontology.org/data_1427.label: Phylogenetic discrete data
http://edamontology.org/data_1427.description: Character data with discrete states that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.

http://edamontology.org/data_1426.label: Phylogenetic continuous quantitative data
http://edamontology.org/data_1426.description: Continuous quantitative data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.

http://edamontology.org/data_2873.label: Phylogenetic gene frequencies data
http://edamontology.org/data_2873.description: Gene frequencies data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.

http://edamontology.org/data_2353.label: Ontology data
http://edamontology.org/data_2353.description: Data concerning or derived from an ontology.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_2858.label: Ontology concept
http://edamontology.org/data_2858.description: A concept from a biological ontology.|This includes any fields from the concept definition such as concept name, definition, comments and so on.

http://edamontology.org/data_0967.label: Ontology concept data
http://edamontology.org/data_0967.description: Data concerning or derived from a concept from a biological ontology.

http://edamontology.org/data_1731.label: Ontology concept definition
http://edamontology.org/data_1731.description: The definition of a concept from an ontology.

http://edamontology.org/data_0582.label: Ontology
http://edamontology.org/data_0582.description: An ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations, a controlled vocabulary, structured glossary etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_2093.label: Data reference
http://edamontology.org/data_2093.description: Reference to a dataset (or a cross-reference between two datasets), typically one or more entries in a biological database or ontology.|A list of database accessions or identifiers are usually included.

http://edamontology.org/data_3509.label: Ontology mapping
http://edamontology.org/data_3509.description: A mapping of supplied textual terms or phrases to ontology concepts (URIs).

http://edamontology.org/data_2872.label: ID list
http://edamontology.org/data_2872.description: A simple list of data identifiers (such as database accessions), possibly with additional basic information on the addressed data.

http://edamontology.org/data_1883.label: Annotated URI
http://edamontology.org/data_1883.description: A URI along with annotation describing the data found at the address.

http://edamontology.org/data_0954.label: Database cross-mapping
http://edamontology.org/data_0954.description: A mapping of the accession numbers (or other database identifier) of entries between (typically) two biological or biomedical databases.|The cross-mapping is typically a table where each row is an accession number and each column is a database being cross-referenced. The cells give the accession number or identifier of the corresponding entry in a database. If a cell in the table is not filled then no mapping could be found for the database. Additional information might be given on version, date etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_2087.label: Molecular property
http://edamontology.org/data_2087.description: A report on the physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of molecules, or parts of a molecule.

http://edamontology.org/data_3425.label: Carbohydrate property
http://edamontology.org/data_3425.description: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all carbohydrates.

http://edamontology.org/data_2753.label: Carbohydrate conformational map
http://edamontology.org/data_2753.description: A conformational energy map of the glycosidic linkages in a carbohydrate molecule.

http://edamontology.org/data_0945.label: Peptide identification
http://edamontology.org/data_0945.description: Protein or peptide identifications with evidence supporting the identifications, for example from comparing a peptide mass fingerprint (from mass spectrometry) to a sequence database, or  the set of typical spectra one obtains when running a protein through a mass spectrometer.

http://edamontology.org/data_0944.label: Peptide mass fingerprint
http://edamontology.org/data_0944.description: A set of peptide masses (peptide mass fingerprint) from mass spectrometry.|A molecular weight standard fingerprint is standard protonated molecular masses e.g. from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides.

http://edamontology.org/data_2140.label: Concentration
http://edamontology.org/data_2140.description: The concentration of a chemical compound.

http://edamontology.org/data_0847.label: QSAR descriptor
http://edamontology.org/data_0847.description: A QSAR quantitative descriptor (name-value pair) of chemical structure.|QSAR descriptors have numeric values that quantify chemical information encoded in a symbolic representation of a molecule. They are used in quantitative structure activity relationship (QSAR) applications. Many subtypes of individual descriptors (not included in EDAM) cover various types of protein properties.

http://edamontology.org/data_0846.label: Chemical formula
http://edamontology.org/data_0846.description: A specification of a chemical structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_2301.label: SMILES string
http://edamontology.org/data_2301.description: A specification of a chemical structure in SMILES format.

http://edamontology.org/data_2016.label: Amino acid property
http://edamontology.org/data_2016.description: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1501.label: Amino acid index
http://edamontology.org/data_1501.description: A table of 20 numerical values which quantify a property (e.g. physicochemical or biochemical) of the common amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1508.label: Amino acid index (van der Waals radii)
http://edamontology.org/data_1508.description: Van der Waals radii of atoms for different amino acid residues.

http://edamontology.org/data_1507.label: Amino acid index (White-Wimley data)
http://edamontology.org/data_1507.description: Experimental free energy values for the water-interface and water-octanol transitions for the amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1506.label: Amino acid index (hydropathy)
http://edamontology.org/data_1506.description: Hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1502.label: Amino acid index (chemical classes)
http://edamontology.org/data_1502.description: Chemical classification (small, aliphatic, aromatic, polar, charged etc) of amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1449.label: Comparison matrix (amino acid)
http://edamontology.org/data_1449.description: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.

http://edamontology.org/data_1917.label: Atomic property
http://edamontology.org/data_1917.description: Data for an atom (in a molecular structure).

http://edamontology.org/data_1858.label: Isotropic B factor
http://edamontology.org/data_1858.description: Isotropic B factor (atomic displacement parameter) for an atom from a PDB file.

http://edamontology.org/data_1857.label: Atomic occupancy
http://edamontology.org/data_1857.description: The fraction of an atom type present at a site in a molecular structure.|The sum of the occupancies of all the atom types at a site should not normally significantly exceed 1.0.

http://edamontology.org/data_1743.label: Atomic coordinate
http://edamontology.org/data_1743.description: Cartesian coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

http://edamontology.org/data_1746.label: Atomic z coordinate
http://edamontology.org/data_1746.description: Cartesian z coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

http://edamontology.org/data_1745.label: Atomic y coordinate
http://edamontology.org/data_1745.description: Cartesian y coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

http://edamontology.org/data_1744.label: Atomic x coordinate
http://edamontology.org/data_1744.description: Cartesian x coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).

http://edamontology.org/data_0912.label: Nucleic acid property
http://edamontology.org/data_0912.description: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a nucleic acid molecule.|The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data. This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_2985.label: Nucleic acid thermodynamic data
http://edamontology.org/data_2985.description: A thermodynamic or kinetic property of a nucleic acid molecule.

http://edamontology.org/data_2139.label: Nucleic acid melting temperature
http://edamontology.org/data_2139.description: A temperature concerning nucleic acid denaturation, typically the temperature at which the two strands of a hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA) molecule separate.

http://edamontology.org/data_1585.label: Nucleic acid entropy
http://edamontology.org/data_1585.description: Entropy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

http://edamontology.org/data_1584.label: Nucleic acid enthalpy
http://edamontology.org/data_1584.description: Enthalpy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).

http://edamontology.org/data_1583.label: Nucleic acid melting profile
http://edamontology.org/data_1583.description: Data on the dissociation characteristics of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or a DNA/RNA hybrid) during heating.|A melting (stability) profile calculated the free energy required to unwind and separate the nucleic acid strands, plotted for sliding windows over a sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_2960.label: Nucleic acid temperature profile
http://edamontology.org/data_2960.description: A temperature profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).|Plots melting temperature versus base position.

http://edamontology.org/data_2959.label: Nucleic acid probability profile
http://edamontology.org/data_2959.description: A probability profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).|Shows the probability of a base pair not being melted (i.e. remaining as double-stranded DNA) at a specified temperature

http://edamontology.org/data_2958.label: Nucleic acid melting curve
http://edamontology.org/data_2958.description: A melting curve of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).|Shows the proportion of nucleic acid which are double-stranded versus temperature.

http://edamontology.org/data_1587.label: Nucleic acid stitch profile
http://edamontology.org/data_1587.description: Stitch profile of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).|A stitch profile diagram shows partly melted DNA conformations (with probabilities) at a range of temperatures. For example, a stitch profile might show possible loop openings with their location, size, probability and fluctuations at a given temperature.

http://edamontology.org/data_2086.label: Nucleic acid structure data
http://edamontology.org/data_2086.description: A report on nucleic acid structure-derived data, describing structural properties of a DNA molecule, or any other annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s).|This includes reports on the stiffness, curvature, twist/roll data or other conformational parameters or properties.

http://edamontology.org/data_2088.label: DNA base structural data
http://edamontology.org/data_2088.description: Structural data for DNA base pairs or runs of bases, such as energy or angle data.

http://edamontology.org/data_2720.label: Dinucleotide property
http://edamontology.org/data_2720.description: Physicochemical property data for one or more dinucleotides.

http://edamontology.org/data_1595.label: Base pairing probability matrix dotplot
http://edamontology.org/data_1595.description: Dotplot of RNA base pairing probability matrix.|Such as generated by the Vienna package.

http://edamontology.org/data_1590.label: DNA base trimer roll angles data
http://edamontology.org/data_1590.description: DNA base trimer roll angles data.

http://edamontology.org/data_1589.label: DNA base pair twist angle data
http://edamontology.org/data_1589.description: DNA base pair twist angle data.

http://edamontology.org/data_1588.label: DNA base pair stacking energies data
http://edamontology.org/data_1588.description: DNA base pair stacking energies data.

http://edamontology.org/data_0897.label: Protein property
http://edamontology.org/data_0897.description: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a protein molecule or model.|The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data. This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_3743.label: Ordination plot
http://edamontology.org/data_3743.description: A plot in which community data (e.g. species abundance data) is summarised.  Similar species and samples are plotted close together, and dissimilar species and samples are plotted placed far apart.

http://edamontology.org/data_3451.label: Rate of association
http://edamontology.org/data_3451.description: Rate of association of a protein with another protein or some other molecule.

http://edamontology.org/data_2970.label: Protein hydropathy data
http://edamontology.org/data_2970.description: A report on protein properties concerning hydropathy.

http://edamontology.org/data_1526.label: Protein globularity
http://edamontology.org/data_1526.description: Data on the stability, intrinsic disorder or globularity of a protein sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1525.label: Protein crystallizability
http://edamontology.org/data_1525.description: Data on the crystallizability of a protein sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1524.label: Protein solubility
http://edamontology.org/data_1524.description: The solubility or atomic solvation energy of a protein sequence or structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_1522.label: Protein sequence hydropathy plot
http://edamontology.org/data_1522.description: A protein sequence with annotation on hydrophobic or hydrophilic / charged regions, hydrophobicity plot etc.|Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.

http://edamontology.org/data_1521.label: Protein aliphatic index
http://edamontology.org/data_1521.description: The aliphatic index of a protein.|The aliphatic index is the relative protein volume occupied by aliphatic side chains.

http://edamontology.org/data_1520.label: Peptide hydrophobic moment
http://edamontology.org/data_1520.description: Report on the hydrophobic moment of a polypeptide sequence.|Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.

http://edamontology.org/data_2165.label: Protein ionisation curve
http://edamontology.org/data_2165.description: A plot of pK versus pH for a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_2024.label: Enzyme kinetics data
http://edamontology.org/data_2024.description: Data concerning chemical reaction(s) catalysed by enzyme(s).|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_2026.label: Hanes Woolf plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2026.description: A plot based on the Michaelis Menten equation of enzyme kinetics plotting the ratio of the initial substrate concentration (S) against the reaction velocity (v).

http://edamontology.org/data_2025.label: Michaelis Menten plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2025.description: A plot giving an approximation of the kinetics of an enzyme-catalysed reaction, assuming simple kinetics (i.e. no intermediate or product inhibition, allostericity or cooperativity). It plots initial reaction rate to the substrate concentration (S) from which the maximum rate (vmax) is apparent.

http://edamontology.org/data_0910.label: Km
http://edamontology.org/data_0910.description: Km is the concentration (usually in Molar units) of substrate that leads to half-maximal velocity of an enzyme-catalysed reaction.

http://edamontology.org/data_0909.label: Vmax
http://edamontology.org/data_0909.description: The maximum initial velocity or rate of a reaction. It is the limiting velocity as substrate concentrations get very large.

http://edamontology.org/data_1545.label: Protein dipole moment
http://edamontology.org/data_1545.description: Data on the net charge distribution (dipole moment) of a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_1534.label: Peptide immunogenicity data
http://edamontology.org/data_1534.description: An report on allergenicity / immunogenicity of peptides and proteins.|This includes data on peptide ligands that elicit an immune response (immunogens), allergic cross-reactivity, predicted antigenicity (Hopp and Woods plot) etc. These data are useful in the development of peptide-specific antibodies or multi-epitope vaccines. Methods might use sequence data (for example motifs) and / or structural data.

http://edamontology.org/data_2957.label: Hopp and Woods plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2957.description: A Hopp and Woods plot of predicted antigenicity of a peptide or protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_1532.label: Protein optical density
http://edamontology.org/data_1532.description: The optical density of a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_1531.label: Protein extinction coefficient
http://edamontology.org/data_1531.description: The extinction coefficient of a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_1530.label: Protein hydrogen exchange rate
http://edamontology.org/data_1530.description: The hydrogen exchange rate of a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_1529.label: Protein pKa value
http://edamontology.org/data_1529.description: The pKa value of a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_1528.label: Protein isoelectric point
http://edamontology.org/data_1528.description: The isoelectric point of one proteins.

http://edamontology.org/data_1527.label: Protein titration curve
http://edamontology.org/data_1527.description: The titration curve of a protein.

http://edamontology.org/data_1523.label: Protein charge plot
http://edamontology.org/data_1523.description: A plot of the mean charge of the amino acids within a window of specified length as the window is moved along a protein sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1519.label: Peptide molecular weights
http://edamontology.org/data_1519.description: List of molecular weight(s) of one or more proteins or peptides, for example cut by proteolytic enzymes or reagents.|The report might include associated data such as frequency of peptide fragment molecular weights.

http://edamontology.org/data_0945.label: Peptide identification
http://edamontology.org/data_0945.description: Protein or peptide identifications with evidence supporting the identifications, for example from comparing a peptide mass fingerprint (from mass spectrometry) to a sequence database, or  the set of typical spectra one obtains when running a protein through a mass spectrometer.

http://edamontology.org/data_2082.label: Matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_2082.description: An array of numerical values.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_3479.label: Gene order
http://edamontology.org/data_3479.description: Multiple gene identifiers in a specific order.|Such data are often used for genome rearrangement tools and phylogenetic tree labeling.

http://edamontology.org/data_3355.label: Emission matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_3355.description: A HMM emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in each of the states of a HMM.|Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing each of the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in the AT-rich state and in the GC-rich state.

http://edamontology.org/data_3354.label: Transition matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_3354.description: A HMM transition matrix contains the probabilities of switching from one HMM state to another.|Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The transition matrix will hold the probabilities of switching from the AT-rich to the GC-rich state, and vica versa.

http://edamontology.org/data_3112.label: Gene expression matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_3112.description: The final processed (normalised) data for a set of hybridisations in a microarray experiment.|This combines data from all hybridisations.

http://edamontology.org/data_2855.label: Distance matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_2855.description: A matrix of distances between molecular entities, where a value (distance) is (typically) derived from comparison of two entities and reflects their similarity.

http://edamontology.org/data_2856.label: Structural distance matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_2856.description: Distances (values representing similarity) between a group of molecular structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1546.label: Protein distance matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1546.description: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_0870.label: Sequence distance matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_0870.description: A matrix of estimated evolutionary distance between molecular sequences, such as is suitable for phylogenetic tree calculation.|Methods might perform character compatibility analysis or identify patterns of similarity in an alignment or data matrix.

http://edamontology.org/data_2854.label: Position-specific scoring matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_2854.description: A simple matrix of numbers, where each value (or column of values) is derived derived from analysis of the corresponding position in a sequence alignment.

http://edamontology.org/data_1365.label: Fingerprint
http://edamontology.org/data_1365.description: One or more fingerprints (sequence classifiers) as used in the PRINTS database.

http://edamontology.org/data_1363.label: Information content matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1363.description: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) derived from a matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position that reflects information content at each position.

http://edamontology.org/data_1362.label: Position weight matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1362.description: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is weighted matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.|Contributions of individual sequences to the matrix might be uneven (weighted).

http://edamontology.org/data_1361.label: Position frequency matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1361.description: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is a simple matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.

http://edamontology.org/data_1501.label: Amino acid index
http://edamontology.org/data_1501.description: A table of 20 numerical values which quantify a property (e.g. physicochemical or biochemical) of the common amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1508.label: Amino acid index (van der Waals radii)
http://edamontology.org/data_1508.description: Van der Waals radii of atoms for different amino acid residues.

http://edamontology.org/data_1507.label: Amino acid index (White-Wimley data)
http://edamontology.org/data_1507.description: Experimental free energy values for the water-interface and water-octanol transitions for the amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1506.label: Amino acid index (hydropathy)
http://edamontology.org/data_1506.description: Hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1502.label: Amino acid index (chemical classes)
http://edamontology.org/data_1502.description: Chemical classification (small, aliphatic, aromatic, polar, charged etc) of amino acids.

http://edamontology.org/data_1494.label: Structural transformation matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1494.description: Matrix to transform (rotate/translate) 3D coordinates, typically the transformation necessary to superimpose two molecular structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1268.label: Amino acid word frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1268.description: A table of amino acid word composition of a protein sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1267.label: Amino acid frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1267.description: A table of amino acid frequencies of a protein sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1266.label: Base word frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1266.description: A table of word composition of a nucleotide sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1265.label: Base frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1265.description: A table of base frequencies of a nucleotide sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_0892.label: Protein sequence-structure scoring matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_0892.description: Matrix of values used for scoring sequence-structure compatibility.

http://edamontology.org/data_1499.label: 3D-1D scoring matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1499.description: A matrix of 3D-1D scores reflecting the probability of amino acids to occur in different tertiary structural environments.

http://edamontology.org/data_0874.label: Comparison matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_0874.description: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid or nucleotide sequence comparison.|The comparison matrix might include matrix name, optional comment, height and width (or size) of matrix, an index row/column (of characters) and data rows/columns (of integers or floats).

http://edamontology.org/data_1449.label: Comparison matrix (amino acid)
http://edamontology.org/data_1449.description: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.

http://edamontology.org/data_1448.label: Comparison matrix (nucleotide)
http://edamontology.org/data_1448.description: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.

http://edamontology.org/data_2080.label: Database search results
http://edamontology.org/data_2080.description: A report of hits from searching a database of some type.

http://edamontology.org/data_0857.label: Sequence search results
http://edamontology.org/data_0857.description: A report of sequence hits and associated data from searching a database of sequences (for example a BLAST search). This will typically include a list of scores (often with statistical evaluation) and a set of alignments for the hits.|The score list includes the alignment score, percentage of the query sequence matched, length of the database sequence entry in this alignment, identifier of the database sequence entry, excerpt of the database sequence entry description etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_2048.label: Report
http://edamontology.org/data_2048.description: A human-readable collection of information including annotation on a biological entity or phenomena, computer-generated reports of analysis of primary data (e.g. sequence or structural), and metadata (data about primary data) or any other free (essentially unformatted) text, as distinct from the primary data itself.|You can use this term by default for any textual report, in case you can't find another, more specific term. Reports may be generated automatically or collated by hand and can include metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.

http://edamontology.org/data_3753.label: Over-representation report
http://edamontology.org/data_3753.description: An informative report containing a ranked list of categories (usually ontology concepts), each associated with a statistical metric of over-/under-representation within the studied data.

http://edamontology.org/data_3754.label: GO-term enrichment report
http://edamontology.org/data_3754.description: An informative report containing a ranked list of Gene Ontology concepts, each associated with a p-value, concerning or derived from the analysis of e.g. a set of genes or proteins.

http://edamontology.org/data_2984.label: Pathway or network report
http://edamontology.org/data_2984.description: An informative report concerning or derived from the analysis of a biological pathway or network, such as a map (diagram) or annotation.

http://edamontology.org/data_3717.label: Isolation report
http://edamontology.org/data_3717.description: A report about any kind of isolation of biological material.

http://edamontology.org/data_3721.label: Isolation source
http://edamontology.org/data_3721.description: A report about any kind of isolation source of biological material e.g. blood, water, soil.

http://edamontology.org/data_3720.label: Geographic location
http://edamontology.org/data_3720.description: A report about localisation of the isolaton of biological material e.g. country or coordinates.

http://edamontology.org/data_3719.label: Biosafety classification
http://edamontology.org/data_3719.description: Information about the biosafety classification of an organism according to corresponding law.

http://edamontology.org/data_3718.label: Pathogenicity report
http://edamontology.org/data_3718.description: Information about the ability of an organism to cause disease in a corresponding host.

http://edamontology.org/data_3739.label: Gamma diversity data
http://edamontology.org/data_3739.description: The total species diversity in a landscape.

http://edamontology.org/data_3738.label: Beta diversity data
http://edamontology.org/data_3738.description: The ratio between regional and local species diversity.

http://edamontology.org/data_3737.label: Alpha diversity data
http://edamontology.org/data_3737.description: The mean species diversity in sites or habitats at a local scale.

http://edamontology.org/data_3558.label: Clinical trial report
http://edamontology.org/data_3558.description: A report concerning a clinical trial.

http://edamontology.org/data_3546.label: Image metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_3546.description: Any data concerning a specific biological or biomedical image.|This can include basic provenance and technical information about the image, scientific annotation and so on.

http://edamontology.org/data_2955.label: Sequence report
http://edamontology.org/data_2955.description: An informative report of information about molecular sequence(s), including basic information (metadata), and reports generated from molecular sequence analysis, including positional features and non-positional properties.

http://edamontology.org/data_2969.label: Sequence image
http://edamontology.org/data_2969.description: Image of a molecular sequence, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.

http://edamontology.org/data_2168.label: Sequence trace image
http://edamontology.org/data_2168.description: Image of a sequence trace (nucleotide sequence versus probabilities of each of the 4 bases).

http://edamontology.org/data_1289.label: Restriction map
http://edamontology.org/data_1289.description: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1254.label: Sequence property
http://edamontology.org/data_1254.description: An informative report about non-positional sequence features, typically a report on general molecular sequence properties derived from sequence analysis.

http://edamontology.org/data_1261.label: Sequence composition report
http://edamontology.org/data_1261.description: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence(s).

http://edamontology.org/data_2167.label: Nucleic acid density plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2167.description: Density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_2166.label: Sequence composition plot
http://edamontology.org/data_2166.description: A plot of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1268.label: Amino acid word frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1268.description: A table of amino acid word composition of a protein sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1267.label: Amino acid frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1267.description: A table of amino acid frequencies of a protein sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1266.label: Base word frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1266.description: A table of word composition of a nucleotide sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1265.label: Base frequencies table
http://edamontology.org/data_1265.description: A table of base frequencies of a nucleotide sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1263.label: Base position variability plot
http://edamontology.org/data_1263.description: A plot of third base position variability in a nucleotide sequence.

http://edamontology.org/data_1260.label: Sequence ambiguity report
http://edamontology.org/data_1260.description: A report on ambiguity in molecular sequence(s).

http://edamontology.org/data_1259.label: Sequence complexity report
http://edamontology.org/data_1259.description: A report on sequence complexity, for example low-complexity or repeat regions in sequences.

http://edamontology.org/data_2762.label: Sequence signature report
http://edamontology.org/data_2762.description: An informative report about a specific or conserved pattern in a molecular sequence, such as its context in genes or proteins, its role, origin or method of construction, etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_3492.label: Nucleic acid signature
http://edamontology.org/data_3492.description: An informative report about a specific or conserved nucleic acid sequence pattern.

http://edamontology.org/data_1355.label: Protein signature
http://edamontology.org/data_1355.description: An informative report about a specific or conserved protein sequence pattern.

http://edamontology.org/data_2531.label: Experiment report
http://edamontology.org/data_2531.description: Annotation on a wet lab experiment, such as experimental conditions.

http://edamontology.org/data_2530.label: Organism report
http://edamontology.org/data_2530.description: An informative report on a specific organism.

http://edamontology.org/data_2711.label: Genome report
http://edamontology.org/data_2711.description: An informative report of general information concerning a genome as a whole.

http://edamontology.org/data_1713.label: Fate map
http://edamontology.org/data_1713.description: A fate map is a plan of early stage of an embryo such as a blastula, showing areas that are significance to development.

http://edamontology.org/data_0963.label: Cell line report
http://edamontology.org/data_0963.description: Report on a particular strain of organism cell line including plants, virus, fungi and bacteria. The data typically includes strain number, organism type, growth conditions, source and so on.

http://edamontology.org/data_2337.label: Resource metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_2337.description: Data concerning or describing some core computational resource, as distinct from primary data.  This includes metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_3113.label: Sample annotation
http://edamontology.org/data_3113.description: Annotation on a biological sample, for example experimental factors and their values.|This might include compound and dose in a dose response experiment.

http://edamontology.org/data_3106.label: System metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_3106.description: Metadata concerning the software, hardware or other aspects of a computer system.

http://edamontology.org/data_2193.label: Database entry metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_2193.description: Basic information on any arbitrary database entry.

http://edamontology.org/data_0960.label: User metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_0960.description: Textual metadata on a software author or end-user, for example a person or other software.

http://edamontology.org/data_0958.label: Tool metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_0958.description: Basic information about one or more bioinformatics applications or packages, such as name, type, description, or other documentation.

http://edamontology.org/data_0957.label: Database metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_0957.description: Basic information on bioinformatics database(s) or other data sources such as name, type, description, URL etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_0949.label: Workflow metadata
http://edamontology.org/data_0949.description: Basic information, annotation or documentation concerning a workflow (but not the workflow itself).

http://edamontology.org/data_2085.label: Structure report
http://edamontology.org/data_2085.description: An informative report on general information, properties or features of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_3128.label: Nucleic acid structure report
http://edamontology.org/data_3128.description: A report on regions within a nucleic acid sequence which form secondary or tertiary (3D) structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_2879.label: Lipid report
http://edamontology.org/data_2879.description: Annotation on or information derived from one or more specific lipid 3D structure(s).

http://edamontology.org/data_2313.label: Carbohydrate report
http://edamontology.org/data_2313.description: Annotation on or information derived from one or more specific carbohydrate 3D structure(s).

http://edamontology.org/data_1537.label: Protein structure report
http://edamontology.org/data_1537.description: Annotation about, or structural information derived from, one or more specific protein 3D structure(s) or structural domains.|This includes for example reports on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure, protein flexibility or motion, and protein architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure).

http://edamontology.org/data_2991.label: Protein geometry report
http://edamontology.org/data_2991.description: Geometry data for a protein structure, for example bond lengths, bond angles, torsion angles, chiralities, planaraties etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1544.label: Ramachandran plot
http://edamontology.org/data_1544.description: Phi/psi angle data or a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_2956.label: Protein secondary structure report
http://edamontology.org/data_2956.description: An informative report about the properties or features of one or more protein secondary structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1542.label: Protein solvent accessibility report
http://edamontology.org/data_1542.description: Data on the solvent accessible or buried surface area of a protein structure.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. This concept covers definitions of the protein surface, interior and interfaces, accessible and buried residues, surface accessible pockets, interior inaccessible cavities etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1539.label: Protein structural quality report
http://edamontology.org/data_1539.description: Report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.|Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes, agreement with electron density maps etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_0906.label: Protein interaction report
http://edamontology.org/data_0906.description: An informative report on interactions (predicted or known) within or between a protein, structural domain or part of a protein. This includes intra- and inter-residue contacts and distances, as well as interactions with other proteins and non-protein entities such as nucleic acid, metal atoms, water, ions etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1566.label: Protein-ligand interaction report
http://edamontology.org/data_1566.description: An informative report on protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).

http://edamontology.org/data_1549.label: Protein hydrogen bonds
http://edamontology.org/data_1549.description: Patterns of hydrogen bonding in protein structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1548.label: Protein residue 3D cluster
http://edamontology.org/data_1548.description: Report on clusters of contacting residues in protein structures such as a key structural residue network.

http://edamontology.org/data_1547.label: Protein contact map
http://edamontology.org/data_1547.description: An amino acid residue contact map for a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_1546.label: Protein distance matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1546.description: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_0962.label: Small molecule report
http://edamontology.org/data_0962.description: An informative report on a specific chemical compound.

http://edamontology.org/data_1696.label: Drug report
http://edamontology.org/data_1696.description: An informative report on a specific drug.

http://edamontology.org/data_1662.label: Drug structure relationship map
http://edamontology.org/data_1662.description: A report typically including a map (diagram) of drug structure relationships.

http://edamontology.org/data_2084.label: Nucleic acid report
http://edamontology.org/data_2084.description: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific nucleic acid molecules, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.

http://edamontology.org/data_3148.label: Gene family report
http://edamontology.org/data_3148.description: An informative report on a particular family of genes, typically a set of genes with similar sequence that originate from duplication of a common ancestor gene, or any other classification of nucleic acid sequences or structures that reflects gene structure.|This includes reports on on gene homologues between species.

http://edamontology.org/data_2354.label: RNA family report
http://edamontology.org/data_2354.description: An informative report on a specific RNA family or other group of classified RNA sequences.

http://edamontology.org/data_3128.label: Nucleic acid structure report
http://edamontology.org/data_3128.description: A report on regions within a nucleic acid sequence which form secondary or tertiary (3D) structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1596.label: Nucleic acid folding report
http://edamontology.org/data_1596.description: A report on an analysis of RNA/DNA folding, minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences, energy landscape of RNA mutants etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1276.label: Nucleic acid features
http://edamontology.org/data_1276.description: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a nucleotide sequence.|This includes nucleotide sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of nucleic acid features.

synonyms: Nucleic acid features (gene and transcript structure)
http://edamontology.org/data_0916.label: Gene report
http://edamontology.org/data_0916.description: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.|This includes any report on a particular locus or gene.  This might include the gene name, description, summary and so on. It can include details about the function of a gene, such as its encoded protein or a functional classification of the gene sequence along according to the encoded protein(s).

http://edamontology.org/data_3134.label: Gene transcript report
http://edamontology.org/data_3134.description: An informative report on features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules. This includes reports on a specific gene transcript, clone or EST.|This includes 5'untranslated region (5'UTR), coding sequences (CDS), exons, intervening sequences (intron) and 3'untranslated regions (3'UTR).

http://edamontology.org/data_0927.label: Genetic linkage report
http://edamontology.org/data_0927.description: An informative report on the linkage of alleles.|This includes linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).

http://edamontology.org/data_0919.label: Chromosome report
http://edamontology.org/data_0919.description: An informative report on a specific chromosome.|This includes basic information. e.g. chromosome number, length, karyotype features, chromosome sequence etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_0972.label: Text mining report
http://edamontology.org/data_0972.description: An abstract of the results of text mining.|A text mining abstract will typically include an annotated a list of words or sentences extracted from one or more scientific articles.

http://edamontology.org/data_0956.label: Data index report
http://edamontology.org/data_0956.description: A report of an analysis of an index of biological data.

http://edamontology.org/data_0920.label: Genotype/phenotype report
http://edamontology.org/data_0920.description: An informative report on the set of genes (or allelic forms) present in an individual, organism or cell and associated with a specific physical characteristic, or a report concerning an organisms traits and phenotypes.

http://edamontology.org/data_1622.label: Disease report
http://edamontology.org/data_1622.description: An informative report on a specific disease.|For example, an informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.

http://edamontology.org/data_1621.label: Pharmacogenomic test report
http://edamontology.org/data_1621.description: Data on the influence of genotype on drug response.|The report might correlate gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.

http://edamontology.org/data_0896.label: Protein report
http://edamontology.org/data_0896.description: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific protein molecules or protein structural domains, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.

http://edamontology.org/data_1537.label: Protein structure report
http://edamontology.org/data_1537.description: Annotation about, or structural information derived from, one or more specific protein 3D structure(s) or structural domains.|This includes for example reports on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure, protein flexibility or motion, and protein architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure).

http://edamontology.org/data_2991.label: Protein geometry report
http://edamontology.org/data_2991.description: Geometry data for a protein structure, for example bond lengths, bond angles, torsion angles, chiralities, planaraties etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1544.label: Ramachandran plot
http://edamontology.org/data_1544.description: Phi/psi angle data or a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_2956.label: Protein secondary structure report
http://edamontology.org/data_2956.description: An informative report about the properties or features of one or more protein secondary structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1542.label: Protein solvent accessibility report
http://edamontology.org/data_1542.description: Data on the solvent accessible or buried surface area of a protein structure.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. This concept covers definitions of the protein surface, interior and interfaces, accessible and buried residues, surface accessible pockets, interior inaccessible cavities etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1539.label: Protein structural quality report
http://edamontology.org/data_1539.description: Report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.|Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes, agreement with electron density maps etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_0906.label: Protein interaction report
http://edamontology.org/data_0906.description: An informative report on interactions (predicted or known) within or between a protein, structural domain or part of a protein. This includes intra- and inter-residue contacts and distances, as well as interactions with other proteins and non-protein entities such as nucleic acid, metal atoms, water, ions etc.

http://edamontology.org/data_1566.label: Protein-ligand interaction report
http://edamontology.org/data_1566.description: An informative report on protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).

http://edamontology.org/data_1549.label: Protein hydrogen bonds
http://edamontology.org/data_1549.description: Patterns of hydrogen bonding in protein structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_1548.label: Protein residue 3D cluster
http://edamontology.org/data_1548.description: Report on clusters of contacting residues in protein structures such as a key structural residue network.

http://edamontology.org/data_1547.label: Protein contact map
http://edamontology.org/data_1547.description: An amino acid residue contact map for a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_1546.label: Protein distance matrix
http://edamontology.org/data_1546.description: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.

http://edamontology.org/data_1277.label: Protein features
http://edamontology.org/data_1277.description: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a protein sequence.|This includes protein sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of protein features.

http://edamontology.org/data_0907.label: Protein family report
http://edamontology.org/data_0907.description: An informative report on a specific protein family or other classification or group of protein sequences or structures.

http://edamontology.org/data_0887.label: Structure alignment report
http://edamontology.org/data_0887.description: An informative report of molecular tertiary structure alignment-derived data.|This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.

http://edamontology.org/data_0867.label: Sequence alignment report
